administration.question: I am skilled at organizing people to accomplish many different tasks and objectives
I can clearly see what needs to be done and implement a plan to make it happen.
I am good at delegating responsibility and trust others to 'do their jobs.'
I like to create ways to make things run efficiently in my life and work.
Details matter to me and I pay special attention to make sure things are done correctly.
My desk or workspace is set up so I can access whatever I need quickly.

discernment.question: I can easily determine whether a statement is true to Scripture or not.
I pay attention to what people say and how they say it, particularly those who teach.
I am a quick and accurate judge of character.
I can readily sense the enemy or a demonic influence in a situation.
I can often tell if someone is being deceitful or dishonest before it becomes apparent to others.
Things tend to be black or white to me; I see things as good or evil, right or wrong, true or false.
Others have told me that my perceptions or judgments of people, situations, or statements have proved trustworthy.

evangelism.question: I can clearly and effectively communicate the Gospel to others.
I feel a burden of compassion for those who are lost without Jesus.
I seek ways to build relationships with non-Christians so that The Lord will use me to share the Gospel with them.
I love to memorize Scripture to share with those who don't know Jesus as their Savior.
I love to share what Christ has done in my life and how He has changed me.
I am not afraid to plead with people to believe that Christ died for their sin and to confess Him as Lord and Savior.
Most of my conversations with non-Christians lead to me speaking about my faith in Jesus.

exhortation.question: I believe everyone needs encouragement in this life, and I love to give it.
When people are discouraged, I remind them of the power and promises of God found in Scripture.
I am compelled to challenge and inspire growth in those whose faith is stagnant.
I am not afraid to challenge someone if I know it will foster spiritual growth and boldness in their life.
Others have told me that my words have compelled them to step out and grow in their faith.
When others are faced with difficult situations, I boldly tell them of the faithfulness of God towards His people.
If a person or a group is stumbling or deviating from the life God has intended for them, I will speak up and press them to remember and return to joyful life in Christ.

faith.question: I live confidently knowing that God is intimately concerned and involved with my life.
I trust God completely to answer my prayers according to His perfect will.
I know God will come through even if I don't see any possible solution to my problem.
I will boldly move forward in a situation if I sense God's calling and provision to do so.
Even when times are tough, I trust God completely to comfort me and provide for my needs.
I don't often worry because of my confidence in God's ability and willingness to see me through every circumstance.
I consistently encourage others to trust God in everything.

giving.question: I live a simple lifestyle so that I can give a larger portion of my income to The Lord's work.
I consistently and joyfully give of my income.
When I give it brings me great joy knowing that more people will be served and touched with the Gospel.
I believe I have been blessed financially so that I may be a blessing to the church and her mission to reach the lost and help the poor.
Stewardship is an important discipline in my daily walk with Christ.
I seek ways to help others financially and share the love of Christ with them.
I give generously and without pretense to the ministry of God's people.

knowledge.question: People often ask me my perspective or interpretation of specific passages of Scripture
The Spirit has brought to my mind information that I have been able to use to minister to others effectively.
I study the Bible regularly in order to share truth with others in and outside the church.
I retain most of what I learn and can recall it quickly when the need arises.
I like to share the truth and insights God has shown me with others.
I am able to relate the truth and realities of the Gospel to all aspects of life.
I can usually recall a Scripture verse or passage that applies to a given situation.

leadership.question: I have been told that I am a 'dreamer.'
I have a vision for my church or ministry and I know what needs to be done to accomplish it.
I am not afraid to take risks to advance the kingdom of God through my church or ministry.
I can readily identify leaders and love to help them grow in their gifts and abilities.
People often look to me to lead a group or project.
I am not afraid to step up and take charge in a crisis situation.
I am more 'visionary' than detail oriented. I concentrate more on the big picture than the day-to-day particulars.

mercy.question: I have great empathy for those who are facing difficult life challenges.
I see the sick or needy as those who most need the love and comfort that Jesus offers.
I care deeply about those who are hurting and want to help them navigate through their tough times.
I love to see people through the storms of life and show them the compassion that Jesus did.
I have been known to 'care too much' and help others in their time of need.
I seek out those who are deemed 'lost causes' and aid them in restoring their lives.
Others have showed appreciation that I have comforted and ministered to them at a low point in their lives.

pastoring.question: I am very protective of the spiritual well-being of others.
I love spending time nurturing and guiding others in their faith.
I desire to help the wounded and lost find healing and shelter in Jesus Christ.
I care about the church and do all I can to see it grow and be built up in love.
I long to see each person in the church fulfilling the Great Commission.
The Gospel of Jesus Christ is the foundation of my life and ministry.
I do not seek the 'spotlight,' but God has called me to shepherd His people.

prophecy.question: At times God has given me a message for an individual or group and compelled me to speak it to them.
There have been occasions that I have received a revelation from the Lord and spoken it to the church.
The Lord has spontaneously given me information about an individual that I felt obligated to confront them with in order to restore them to God.
God has put in my mind urgent matters that were otherwise unknown that I have announced to the church.
I have suddenly received a message from God specific to our congregation and shared it for the edification of the entire church.
Others have recognized that often God has spoken clearly and directly to them through a message I have shared.
I am always listening for the Spirit of God and I am open to receiving whatever message He has for me to share.

serving.question: I enjoy doing everyday tasks that support the various ministries of the church.
I readily volunteer to help in church when I know it will fill a practical need.
I like to be in the background and have no need of recognition for my service in the church.
I set aside time in my week to help those in need in my church and community.
If I recognize a need in the church I simply fill it without being asked.
I believe there is eternal significance in performing mundane tasks and service.
I find joy in being a helper and assisting others in their ministries.

teaching.question: I spend large amounts of time studying the Word of God knowing that my effort will make a difference in someone's life.
I effectively communicate the Bible in ways that influence and motivate others to learn more.
I am able to explain deep theological truths in ways that even a child can understand them.
I hate it when someone uses Scripture out of context for their own purposes.
I pay attention to the words people use because each one is significant and has meaning.
I love discovering how the Gospel is woven throughout the entire Bible as I increasingly spend time in study.
Often the Holy Spirit gives me just the right words to say when I am teaching an individual or group.

wisdom.question: I often have helpful insights into situations that have not been made clear to others.
I have learned through my experiences in life and can often guide others who are facing similar difficulties or challenges that I have had.
I often help people by offering Scriptural lessons and principles as solutions to life's various challenges.
I can see where a group or individual's decisions and actions will lead them, and I offer to guide them in the right direction.
It is humbling to me when someone asks for my guidance, so I take great care to help them.
I can easily see which plan or strategy is the best one in a given circumstance.
I can often see through the confusion or conflict in a situation and provide a practical and Scriptural solution to it.

discernment.name: Discernment
discernment.definition: to clearly distinguish truth from error by judging whether the behavior or teaching is from God, Satan, human error, or human power

knowledge.name: Knowledge
knowledge.definition: to seek to learn as much about the Bible as possible through the gathering of much information and the analyzing of that data

teaching.name: Teaching
teaching.definition: to instruct others in the Bible in a logical, systematic way so as to communicate pertinent information for true understanding and growth
